availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mathew Spalding (Union County, Kentucky, enslaved man and soldier.)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, enslaved man and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Ann Spalding. Father of William Spalding and Thomas Spalding. Enslaved by Ignatius A. Spalding in Union County. Served in the 13th United States Colored Heavy Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from March 14, 1865, to November 18, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Morganfield, p. 326A.
Compiled Military Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served with the United States Colored Troops: Artillery Organizations, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M1818, Roll 0259.
KYR-0001-004-3103.
